column1: 3.3.2	  Pathology of muscle-invasive bladder cancer  All MIBC cases are high-grade UCs. For this reason, no prognostic information can be provided by grading MIBC   [68]. Identification of morphological subtypes is important for prognostic reasons and treatment decisions [69-71].
Council patients to stop active and avoid passive smoking.

Inform workers in potentially hazardous workplaces of the potential carcinogenic effects of   a number of recognised substances, including duration of exposure and latency periods.   Protective measures are recommended.
Do not prescribe pioglitazone to patients with active bladder cancer or a history of bladder   cancer.
